intro: Corrigiola capensis subsp. africana, commonly known as African sandmat, is a low-growing succulent plant native to southern Africa. It features fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is drought-tolerant. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments.
